function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'main'?
loop_reachability: Is it possible that the loop with condition 'i < 3' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'i < 3' always executed?
Is it possible that the loop with condition 'j < 5' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'j < 5' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < 3' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'j < 5' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Is variable 'argc' used after its definition?
Does the value assigned to 'argv' affect subsequent computations?
liveness: Is variable 'mat' live at the end of function 'main'?
Does variable 'argc' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
dead_code: Is the statement 'printf("[%d][%d]. %p\n", i, j, &mat[i][j]);' unreachable?
Is this statement not dead: “printf("[%d]. %p\n", i, mat+i);”?
